unnormalised: Delhi's air quality is back in the news, folks, and not in a good way! Remember that smog from Diwali? Well, it seems to be lingering, and experts are worried. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data is showing a steady rise in PM2.5 levels across the NCR region.
normalised: Delhi's air quality is back in the news, folks, and not in a good way! Remember that smog from Diwali? Well, it seems to be lingering, and experts are worried. The Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B) data is showing a steady rise in P M two point five levels across the N C R region.

unnormalised: We’re talking hazardous levels in some areas, folks. Time to dust off those pollution masks!
normalised: We’re talking hazardous levels in some areas, folks. Time to dust off those pollution masks!

unnormalised: Think back to that scene from "Delhi 6," where the smog practically swallowed the city – we don’t want to head back there.
normalised: Think back to that scene from "Delhi six," where the smog practically swallowed the city – we don’t want to head back there.

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM) is running models to predict how the situation will develop over the next few days. Factors like stubble burning in Punjab and Haryana, coupled with cooler temperatures, are contributing to this mess.
normalised: The Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (I I T M) is running models to predict how the situation will develop over the next few days. Factors like stubble burning in Punjab and Haryana, coupled with cooler temperatures, are contributing to this mess.

unnormalised: The government is urging people to use public transport, carpool, and avoid burning waste. Let's hope things improve soon, before we need to start rationing fresh air like pani puri on a hot day! Stay safe and breathe easy (or at least, try to!). Remember, every small action counts.
normalised: The government is urging people to use public transport, carpool, and avoid burning waste. Let's hope things improve soon, before we need to start rationing fresh air like pani puri on a hot day! Stay safe and breathe easy (or at least, try to!). Remember, every small action counts.
